intro: Miyamayomena simplex, commonly known as the Japanese rock rose, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its simple, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage is evergreen, with small, leathery leaves that provide year-round interest. Miyamayomena simplex is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
